name: American Foreign Service Association v. Garfinkel
Rodriguez De Quijas v. Shearson/Am. Exp.
Sheet Metal Workers International Assn. v. Lynn
Texas Monthly, Inc. v. Bullock
question: Does a state violate the Establishment Clause and the Free Press Clause by exempting religious publications from paying taxes that all nonreligious publications must pay?

name: Northwest Central Pipeline Corporation v. State Corporation Commission of Kansas
Mansell v. Mansell
question: Under the Uniformed Services Former Spouses’ Protection Act, can state courts treat military retirement pay that was waived by the retiree in order to receive veterans’ disability benefits as something divisible upon divorce?
description: A case in which the Court held that the federal Uniformed Services Former Spouses' Protection Act exempted that portion of the retirement pay that a service member waived in order to receive disability benefits from the amount divisible upon divorce.

name: Penry v. Lynaugh
question: Was Penry's sentence cruel and unusual punishment?

name: National Treasury Employees Union v. Von Raab
question: Did the regulations violate the Fourth Amendment?

name: Town of Huntington v. Huntington Branch, National Association for the Advancement of Colored People
Volt Information Sciences, Inc. v. Board of Trustees, Leland Stanford Junior University
Bonito Boats, Inc. v. Thunder Craft Boats, Inc.
question: Does a state statute, which prohibits the use of the direct molding process of a vessel that does not have patent protection and the sale of the duplicates, conflict with the federal patent law and therefore make it invalid under the Supremacy Clause of the Eleventh Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that a state statute that contradicts with the public policy behind federal statutes is invalid.

name: McKesson Corporation v. Division of Alcoholic Beverages and Tobacco, Department of Business Regulation of Florida
Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press
question: Is a refusal to disclose an individual's personal FBI crime record to a third party justifiable under the "personal privacy" invasion exemption of the Freedom of Information Act?

name: Chan v. Korean Air Lines, Ltd.
Brower v. Inyo County
question: Can a police roadblock constitute an illegal seizure under the Fourth Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that a police roadblock could constitute an illegal seizure under the Fourth Amendment.

name: Board of Trustees of State University of New York v. Fox
Will v. Michigan Department of State Police
Oring v. State Bar of Cal.
Webster v. Reproductive Health Services
question: Did the Missouri restrictions unconstitutionally infringe upon the right to privacy or the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that measures put in place by the Missouri legislature to prevent abortion were not unconstitutional.

name: Public Citizen v. United States Department of Justice
Skinner v. Railway Labor Executives' Association
question: Did the regulations violate the Fourth Amendment?

name: Duckworth v. Eagan
question: Did the first warning and waiver negate the constitutional protections required by Miranda v. Arizona?

name: Sable Communications of California v. Federal Communications Commission
question: Did the amended Communications Act violate the First and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Community for Creative Non-Violence v. Reid
question: Is the making of a sculpture for an organization, by someone who contracts with the organization but is not its employee, a "work made for hire" as defined by the Copyright Act of 1976, 17 U.S.C. Section 101?

name: Hernandez v. Commissioner of Internal Revenue
Fort Wayne Books, Inc. v. Indiana
Martin v. Wilks
question: Did Wilks and other white firefighters have a constitutional right to challenge the previously established decrees?

name: California State Bd. of Equalization v. Sierra Summit, Inc.
American Trucking Associations, Inc. v. Smith
question: (1) Does the Court's decision in Scheiner apply retroactively? (2) Even if the Scheiner decision does not apply retroactively, can the state keep taxes collected before the escrow account was established when those taxes are for the tax year July 1, 1987 to June 30, 1988, a period after Scheiner?

name: Karahalios v. National Federation of Federal Employees, Local 1263
Colonial American Life Ins. Company v. Commissioner of Internal Revenue
Robertson v. Methow Valley Citizens Council
Mallard v. United States Dist. Court for Southern Dist. of Iowa
Ohio Pub. Employees Retirement System v. Betts
Coit Independence Joint Venture v. Federal Savings and Loan Insurance Corporation
Caplin & Drysdale, Chartered v. United States
Frank v. Minnesota Newspaper Association, Inc.
Owens v. Okure
question: Should courts uphold a state's general statute of limitations for personal injury suits under 42 U.S.C 1983 over the individual statute of limitations of intentional torts?
description: A case in which the Court held that, when a state has multiple statutes of limitations for intentional torts, courts should use the general statute of limitations for claims of liability under 42 U.S.C. 1983.

name: Board of Estimate of City of New York v. Morris
H.J. Inc. v. Northwestern Bell Telephone Company
Cotton Petroleum Corporation v. New Mexico
United States v. Halper
question: Where the penalty authorized under the False Claims Act is "entirely unrelated" to the damages actually suffered by the government, does imposition of the penalty amount to a "punishment" governed by the Double Jeopardy Clause of the 5th Amendment?

name: City of Canton, Ohio v. Harris
question: Is a municipality liable for failure to provide adequate training to an employee that resulted in a deprivation of constitutional rights?

name: Harbison-Walker Refractories, Div. of Dresser Industries, Inc. v. Brieck
Firestone Tire & Rubber Company v. Bruch
Graham v. Connor
question:
(1) Must Graham show that the police acted “maliciously and sadistically for the very purpose of causing harm” to establish his claim that Charlotte police used excessive force?

(2) Must Graham’s claim that law enforcement officials used excessive force be examined under the Fourth Amendment’s “objective reasonableness” standard?

name: Kentucky Department of Corrections v. Thompson
Green v. Bock Laundry Machine Company
Granfinanciera, S. A. v. Nordberg
question: Does a person who has submitted a claim against a bankruptcy estate have a right to a jury trial when sued by the trustee in bankruptcy to recover an allegedly fraudulent money transfer?
description: A case in which the Court held that the Seventh Amendment protected the right to a trial by jury in all cases in which a legal right, as opposed to an equitable right, was at issue.

name: Independent Federation of Flight Attendants v. Zipes
Price Waterhouse v. Hopkins
question: Did the Court of Appeals err in requiring the employer to prove it would have made the same employment decision in the absence of discrimination by clear and convincing evidence?

name: Massachusetts v. Morash
question:
(1) Does a company’s policy of paying its discharged employees for their unused vacation time constitute an employee welfare benefit plan within the meaning of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA)?

(2) Does ERISA’s broad pre-emption provision foreclose a criminal action to enforce that policy?
description: A case in which the Court concluded that an employee’s unused vacation time does not constitute an employee welfare benefit plan under the Employment Retirement Income Security Act of 1974.

name: Marsh v. Oregon Natural Resources Council
Texas v. Johnson
question: Is the desecration of an American flag, by burning or otherwise, a form of speech that is protected under the First Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that burning the American Flag is protected free speech under the First Amendment.

name: McNamara v. County of San Diego Dept. of Social Servs.
DeShaney v. Winnebago County Department of Social Services
question: Does a state's failure to protect an individual against private violence constitute a violation of the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Consolidated Rail Corporation v. Railway Labor Executives' Association
question: Does the RLEA's opposition to Conrail's changed drug testing program create a "major" dispute under the Railway Labor Act?

name: Frazee v. Illinois Department of Employment Security
question: Must a person who declines to work on Sunday because of a sincerely-held religious conviction prove that his conviction is a tenet of an established religious sect or body in order to claim the protection of the First Amendment guarantee of free exercise of religion?

name: Florida v. Riley
question: Did the police officer violate the defendant’s reasonable expectation of privacy by observing his property from a helicopter with the naked eye?
description: A case in which the Court held that a police officer did not violate the defendant’s reasonable expectation of privacy by observing his property from a helicopter with the naked eye.

name: United States Department of Justice v. Tax Analysts
Blanton v. City of North Las Vegas, Nevada
Mistretta v. United States
question: Did the Act violate the nondelegation doctrine of the Constitution?

name: Michael H. v. Gerald D.
question: Does Cal. Evid. Code 621 violate the Due Process Clause by denying a possible biological father the chance to establish his paternity of a child after two years have passed since the child's birth?

name: Jett v. Dallas Independent School District
Harte-Hanks Communications, Inc. v. Connaughton
question: Did the newspaper’s reporting of the scandal exhibit “actual malice”?
description: A case in which the Court held that a public figure plaintiff in a libel case must prove that the libelous statement was false or made without any regard for its truth.

name: City of Richmond v. J. A. Croson Company
question: Did the Richmond law violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Browning-Ferris Industries of Vermont, Inc. v. Kelco Disposal, Inc.
Trans World Airlines, Inc. v. Independent Federation of Flight Attendants
Arizona v. Youngblood
question: Does the state’s failure to preserve potentially useful evidence constitute a denial of due process?
description: A case in which the Court held that a criminal defendant must show bad faith on the part of the police to prove that the loss or destruction of evidence was a denial of due process.

name: United States v. Ron Pair Enterprises, Inc.
Shell Oil Company v. Iowa Department of Revenue
Allegheny Pittsburgh Coal Company v. County Commission of Webster County, West Virginia
Missouri v. Jenkins
question: Under the Civil Rights Attorney's Fees Awards Act of 1976, does the Eleventh Amendment prohibit a federal court from requiring a state to pay lawyers at current market rates for past litigation? Can legal assistants be charged at current market rates rather than at their cost to the lawyers at the time of litigation?

name: Eu v. San Francisco County Democratic Central Comm.
United States v. Sokolow
question: Did the search violate the Fourth Amendment?

name: Florida Star v. B. J. F.
question: May a state impose criminal and civil sanctions on a newspaper for printing lawfully-obtained truthful information found in government records?

name: Argentine Republic v. Amerada Hess Shipping Corporation
Hoffman v. Connecticut Department of Income Maintenance
Stanford v. Kentucky
question: Does the imposition of the death sentence on convicted capital offenders below the age of 18 years old, violate the Eighth Amendment's protection against cruel and unusual punishment?

name: National Collegiate Athletic Association v. Tarkanian
County of Allegheny v. American Civil Liberties Union, Greater Pittsburgh Chapter
question: Did the public displays violate the Establishment Clause of the First Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that depending on its "particular physical setting," some displays of religious celebrations on government property were a violation of the Establishment Clause of the First Amendment.

name: Pittsburgh & Lake Erie Railroad Company v. Railway Labor Executives' Association
Commissioner of Internal Revenue v. Clark
Murray v. Giarratano
question: Are States required under the Sixth Amendment and the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment to appoint counsel for indigent death row inmates seeking state post-conviction relief?
description: A case in which the Court held that States are not required to appoint counsel for indigent death row inmates seeking state post-conviction relief under the Sixth Amendment and the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment.

name: Amerada Hess Corporation v. Director, Division of Taxation, New Jersey Department of the Treasury
Ward v. Rock Against Racism
question: Does the New York ordinance substituting a city-employed technician and mixing board for a performer's mixer and equipment violate the First Amendment?

name: City of Dallas v. Stanglin
question:
(1) Do age restrictions on social gathering violate the First Amendment right to freedom of association?

(2) Do age restrictions on social gathering violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment of the Constitution?
description: A case in which the Court held that an ordinance regulating the age of patrons at dance halls did not violate the First Amendment right to freedom of association or the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment.

name: Brendale v. Confederated Tribes & Bands of Yakima Indian Nation
Mississippi Choctaw Indian Band v. Holyfield
Texas State Teachers Association v. Garland Independent School District
Wards Cove Packing Company, Inc. v. Atonio
question: Once employees present evidence of racial disparity among different classes of jobs, does the employer have to justify this disparity as a "business necessity" in order to avoid a "disparate impact" lawsuit under Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964?

name: Midland Asphalt Corporation v. United States
Davis v. Michigan Department of the Treasury
question: Did Michigan violate federal law when it exempted state and local government pensions from taxation but levied taxes on federal government pensions?

name: New Orleans Public Service, Inc. v. Council of the City of New Orleans
Thornburgh v. Abbott
question: Does the First Amendment prohibit the Federal Bureau of Prisons from denying prisoners access to certain publications?
description: A case in which the Court held that the First Amendment does not prohibit the Federal Bureau of Prisons from rejecting certain publications if said publications are detrimental to penological interests.
